result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry Eugene Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
- Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
- Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
- Possess no weapons. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.

- No contact with the victim without approval of the Court.
- No illegal drugs or alcohol.

- Mental health assessment, comply with all recommended treatment.
- Successfully complete Batterer's Intervention Programming.
- Cooperate fully with probation agent.
- Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

- AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Barry Eugene Miller not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 09-25-15 Court order imposing 30 days of condition time

Defendant Barry Eugene Miller not in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 30 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.

Defendant Barry Eugene Miller in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Barry Eugene Miller in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 3:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing. 
.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  In addition, the defendant accepts responsibility and admits his involvement in other incidents not charged to be READ-IN for sentencing/restitution.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.  Additional statements made by Tina M. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT OF 3 1/2 YEARS, with credit for 0 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  
.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program; is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
.
Court IMPOSED BUT STAYED the Sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years with the following conditions:
-Defendant to serve 30 DAYS in the House of Correction, STAYED until next court date. 
-Mental health assessment, comply with all recommended treatment.
-Successfully complete Batterer's Intervention Programming.
-AODA assessment and comply with treatment.
-Absolute sobriety-no illegal drugs or alcohol.
-Random urine screens.
-No Contact with the victim without approval of the Court.
-Possess no weapons.
-Cooperate fully with probation agent.
-Maintain full time employment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and fees in this action during period of Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 60 days time served.  

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
.
Defendant ordered to provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge during Probation, or to be docketed as a civil judgment.
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Barry Eugene Miller in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Defendant Barry Eugene Miller in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tina M.

Defendant Barry Eugene Miller in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Barry Eugene Miller in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Commissioner entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to counts 2 and 3 on behalf of the Defendant. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
